html: 4.1.25  11:19 pm   I'm insanely curious about your songs and their meanings and deeply interested in figuring out in its entirety. Would you think this is something that's possible for someone not even acquainted with you? I heard that every lyric you write is deliberate and I would believe that immediately. Either way, whether you say it's possible or not I'm still likely gonna try. Expect a 10 hour analysis video about your videos someday in the future mr wurtz. I have immense respect and curiosity for you.

3.31.25  10:52 pm   If you divide human traits into 60 traits with normalized probability distributions (a low estimate given how many traits there can be) the chance that one person falls into the normal part of all 60 distributions is (0.683)^60 or 1.132*10^-10, a 1 in 1 trillion chance. This means that probably no one on Earth is "normal" but it also means your chance of falling into the top 1% on at least one of those traits is 1âˆ’(0.99)^60 or 45.3%. This becomes more likely the more traits you consider. Do you think these statistics nerds rediscovered something fundamental about human nature that we already knew?
